results.title: Lucy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”.
Lucy, 21 months and in foster care for 19 days, is too young to carry a clear image of the absent mother and readily accepts her foster mother’s care. The film shows in dramatic fashion the conflict of emotions that Lucy experiences when required to leave her foster mother’s care even though she is happy to return to her natural mother.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”.
A study of a two-year-old child in 27 days separation from her mother, following her changing adjustment to fostercare.

results.title: Thomas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”
Thomas, a child of 2 years and 4 months spends ten days in foster care, in a family situation, He understands the reasons for the separation, and maintains a clear image of his absent mother.

results.title: John
results.creator_credit: James Robertson, Joyce Robertson and Tavistock Institute of Human Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”.
A nine day record of the changes in the behaviour of a 17 months old boy in a residential nursery. Interesting observation of a young child experiencing pain of separation from loving parents. Commentary by Joyce Robertson.

results.title: Randolph Stow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed on location in the landscapes of Suffolk and East Angliam, his present home, Randolf Stow talks of his life and shares examples of his poetry and prose.

results.title: Writers Talking
results.brief_description: An insightful series of documentary portraits of Australian writers made with the assistance of the Archival Film Program and Literary Arts Board of the Australia Council.

results.title: Roland Robinson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
A poet with a strong attachment to the Australian landscape, Roland Robinson has a deep interest in Aboriginal lore, and performs his poetry with a memorable verve.

results.title: Peter Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
From his book-crammed London flat, Peter Porter introduces a variety of his best-known poems and presents his accessible and humane intelligence.
results.description:

results.title: David Malouf: an imaginary life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Poet and novelist David Malouf was filmed in Tuscany, Italy, during the coldest winter there for 50 years, and in Sydney during a steamy summer. To write, he says, you must turn your back on even the most beautiful landscape. Malouf talks about the influences on his work and how he gets into the writing process.
